word:
One Man's Mind Not to Be Trusted.--One man's mind and one man's judgment was not to be trusted, for too great interests were at stake, and it was not free from human frailties and human errors. . . . There is not any 

24 

one man's mind so perfect that there is no danger of his moving from wrong motives, viewing things from a wrong standpoint.--Lt 41, 1891.
